choices.E: WPA3 uses AES for stronger protection than WPA2, which uses TKIP.

discussion.content: WPA2 uses 128-bit key encryption with AES, while WPA3 supports 128-bit and 192-bit key encryption with AES and the new SAE protocol for key establishment.

questions.question_text: What are two differences between WPA2 and WPA3 wireless security? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

WPA2 already employs 802.1x authentication and AES-128 encryption. 
WPA3 enhances security by introducing stronger encryption protocols and authentication methods beyond what WPA2 offers.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct:
Additionally, WPA3 personal and enterprise connections requires PMF (Protected Management Frame) negotiation mandatorily. PMF provides an additional layer of protection from de-authentication and disassociation attacks.

questions.question_text: What is an enhancement implemented in WPA3?

choices.D: defends against deauthentication and disassociation attacks
choices.B: employs PKI and RADIUS to identify access points
